meanings.definition: The state of being bored or uninterested.
meanings.sent1: Her face showed the boredoms she felt during the long lecture.
meanings.sent2: The boredoms of waiting in line at the store made him tap his foot impatiently.
meanings.sent3: The boredoms of watching paint dry seemed more exciting than this.
meanings.sent4: The boredoms of everyday life weighed on her like a heavy blanket.
meanings.sent5: The boredoms of the rainy day made time move at a snail's pace.

meanings.definition: The feeling of being bored or uninterested.
meanings.sent1: His yawns and fidgeting clearly showed his boredoms during the meeting.
meanings.sent2: The boredoms she felt while reading the book made her put it down after a few pages.
meanings.sent3: The boredoms of the movie were so strong, she almost fell asleep in the theater.
meanings.sent4: The boredoms of the repetitive task made the minutes drag like hours.
meanings.sent5: The boredoms of the long car ride made her count the trees along the road.

meanings.definition: The quality or state of being tiresome or dull.
meanings.sent1: The boredoms of the monotonous job made him dream of a more exciting career.
meanings.sent2: The lecture's boredoms were only broken by the occasional joke from the professor.
meanings.sent3: The boredoms of the rainy day were suddenly lifted when a rainbow appeared.
meanings.sent4: The boredoms of the routine were shattered by the unexpected visitor at the door.
meanings.sent5: The boredoms of the plain white walls were brightened by colorful paintings.
